meanings.definition: In a way that sticks or holds things together.
meanings.sent1: The tape was adhesively attached to the paper.
meanings.sent2: She adhesively sealed the envelope shut.
meanings.sent3: The glue worked adhesively to keep the pieces together.
meanings.sent4: The sticker clung adhesively to the surface.
meanings.sent5: The bandage was adhesively stuck to his skin.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of sticking or adhering.
meanings.sent1: The adhesively coated surface was perfect for the project.
meanings.sent2: The adhesively nature of the substance made it ideal for the task.
meanings.sent3: The adhesively properties of the material surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her adhesively hands were always covered in glue.
meanings.sent5: The adhesively surface held everything in place.

meanings.definition: In a manner that causes two surfaces to stick together.
meanings.sent1: The two pieces were adhesively joined together.
meanings.sent2: He pressed the two surfaces adhesively to ensure they stuck.
meanings.sent3: The magnets adhesively attracted to each other.
meanings.sent4: The tape adhesively connected the two ends.
meanings.sent5: The stickers adhesively held the poster on the wall.
